column4: Hello all, I've been messing with my GRUB settings lately, and although I managed to get a splashscreen on it, the Ubuntu Bootup animation(the loading up bar?) seems to have broken. The bootup is now text based. Is there anyway to fix this?
the line that starts with "kernel" is what i meant
no.. just get it out of your menu.lst
do you need vga=795 to boot?
by default, you only have splash and quiet
so i assume you added vga=795 yourself
i'd take out vga=795 from defoptions and then run "sudo update-grub"
initrd is on its own line
that specifies the strange strange ramfs thingy
er... show me your menu.lst now?
hrm. no idea then. by the way, the next time the kernel gets upgraded, update-grub is going to be run and vga=795 will be added back in because you didn't remove it from defoptions
you can address 4GB of virtual space, but not all of it is in RAM and some of it is reserved by the kernel
